intro: Koeleria pulchella, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial grass that typically reaches heights of 10 to 20 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pink to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Koeleria pulchella is adapted to withstand drought and full sun, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
